page.lettertext:
fol.279r
Belgia: 1590. Sep
t
Belgia 1590 22 Sep
t
To my L. Trea
s
May yt please yo
r
good L. my last unto yo
u
of the 21 of
this moneth, was an awnswere to her
Ma
tyes
l
res
of the
10
th
. & to yo
r
L. of
e 7 & 10
th
of the same, wherin
as then I could not write of any certaine resolution
that the
states
had taken, but after many meeting
they have now determined to
e same effect, as they by
their letters will signify them selves, That the
greatest
t of theyr forces shalbee p
nt
ly dispatched
for
Brabant
, w
th
spetiall charge to annoy the Ennemy
in those quarters, by all meanes possible, & to enter
also into
Haynault
as far as they are able. wh
r
by
they are in hope that
e
Duke of Parma
th
r
uppon, will
either retire or send some
te of his strength to
relieve those countreys. Moreover they have Rxd fresh
letters from theyr agent
in
Fraunce
by whom they are
sollicited in
e name of
e
King
to employ theyr forces
above all oth
r
places, into
Flanders
, for w
ch
cause &
because her Ma
ty
hath made
e self same motion
they have concluded to entreat her Hig
nes
by theyr lett
rs
to send to
Oostend
or to some oth
r
te of Flanders
some convenient company of men, w
th
whom they have
resolved upon certificate given of the nomber
time and place
to joyne
so many more of theyr owne troupes, as together
w
th
her Ma
tyes
may bee able to
forme some
singul
r
exploit./ It is fard
r
heer agreed
t
the
spetialityes of theyr late negotiacion w
th
the German
Embassado
rs
shalbe sent to
M
r
Ortell
, to bee related
to her Hig
nes
. The places w
ch
they have promised to
restore, are Budick & Luttekehove, & some oth
r
littel
fort
that belong to
Cleave
. Also now they will give
ov
r
Graeff w
ch
was wonne by
S
r
Francis Vere
the 16
of this moneth. & since that time the
Beek
, w
ch
wee
are newly adv
r
tised S
r
Francis hath taken, being a castell
of good strength. Because the mainten
a
ce of garrisons
in those places would prove very chargeable to
e
states, & litell benefit come of yt, they have thought
yt better to deliver th
e
over to
e
Duke of Cleave
, then
to hold them any longer for them selves. Nev
r
theles as
I have signifyed heer in Councell, they have made this
accord against the 21 Articles of theyr Contract w
th
her
Ma
ty
, wh
r
in yt is
vided that they shall not onely not
treat w
th
the Enemy, but w
th
no other Prince or Potentate
fol.279v
Belgia 1590: Sep
t
stranger without
e spetiall privity & approbation of her
Ma
ty
, w
ch
of all oth
r
matters they might worst seem
to do in
e restitution of those fort
, w
ch
were conquered
so lately wth the losse of
e lives of her Ma
tyes
subject
.
Happely my speeches hereof have moved them to acquaint her Hignes w
th
theyr manner of
ceeding, w
ch
they might
have don before duryng
e time of the abod of the
Embassado
r
heer, w
ch
was 5 weekes at
e least.
At
e writing heerof
Raynold Peeterson
of
Horne
is come unto mee. of whom I have enquired as yo
r
L. willed. But he knoweth nothing more then I have
certified before. for of those
ticular m
r
k
w
ch
yo
r
L.
would know for
e better discovery of
e
ty, becaus hee
nev
r
saw him in
son, but hath all his informations fr
o
his Cousen of
Embden
, hee cannot awnswer me to any
thing. Howbeyt yf his Cosen be retourned out of
Spain
, as hee supposeth hee ys, or wilbe very shortly
he hath
mised to
cure him to come heth
r
or to c
r
tify
by writing, whatsoever hee knoweth. Also hee himself
doth goe for Spain, w
th
in this moneth, &
fereth to enquire
not onely of this matter but of any thing els that I
shall require him. & a man of his profession may
conveniently learne.
M
r
Gilpin
doth call to
minde, that
Mr Wilk
being heer, told him of one
as farr as hee can remember an Arrogonesse
that should come out of Spaine or
Portingall
to
Don Ant
[onio]
& hath acquainted her Ma
ty
w
t h
some speciall meanes to
trouble
K Phillip
in his owne dominions. Hee canno
[t]
say distinctly what was told him, but some such
matter was told him, w
ch
I would not omytt to im
te
w
th
yo
r
L. because of some likelihood that hee might
prove to bee
e same
ty.
& thus I take my humble le
[ave]
Hage
. Se
p
22 1590.
